title: ASX to firm on open after US rate cut; ANZ profit hit
text:
Luke Housego

Galilee Energy's Glenaras pilot programme at its coal seam gas project in the Galilee Basin in Queensland progressed de-watering.

The company said measured gas flow from the project is up 35–40 thousand standard cubic feet per day in aggregate and water rates continue to decline which is depressuring area and increasing gas production.

But the company said one of its wells on the site went through several production and downhole pump issues but that all four remaining will be producing at maximum performance.

The pilot will be on production for an extended period to de-water and lower the pressure in the surrounding coal to achieve gas flow.
description: Fed's cut and hawkish undertones; ANZ profit falls 7pc; ASX futures point to moderate lift at the start of trade.
